body.directions: Please read the phrases in Chinese, and then answer the question that follows.

body.quiz: Which of the following words have the same pinyin initial as the 2nd character in the word?
body.answer: Audio for 果汁 guǒzhī
options: Audio for 儿子 érzi
Audio for 继母 jìmǔ
Audio for 菜单 càidān
body.correct: Job excellently done! The 2nd character 壮 in 健壮 jiànzhuàng has the initial “zh,” which is also in the 2nd character for the word 果汁 guǒzhī (juice).
body.incorrect: Almost…try to sound out the word and identify the initial of its 2nd character; then compare it with the audios in the options.

body.quiz: Which of the following is the antonym of the word presented?
body.correct: Job wonderfully done! The word 胖pàng means “fat,” and its antonym (word with opposite meaning) is 瘦 shòu (skinny).
body.incorrect: Not quite… think about the meaning of the word; then consider what its opposite (antonym) should be.

body.quiz: Which of the following sentences can be completed using the word presented?
body.answer: Smith 小姐很______。 Smith xiǎojiě hěn_____.
options: 我的头发是______的。 Wǒde tóufà shì _____ de.
body.correct: You got it! 年轻 niánqīng (young) can be used to describe a person—Smith 小姐很年轻。 Smith xiǎojiě hěn niánqīng. (Ms. Smith is very young.)
body.incorrect: So close! Think about the meaning of the word and how it can be fitted into one of the sentences properly.

body.quiz: Keysie has a loving family. Which of the following family members of hers can the word presented be used to describe?
body.correct: You got it! 年老 niánlǎo means “old.” It can be used to describe Keysie’s 78-year-old grandpa.
body.incorrect: So close! Think about the meaning of the word, and consider what range of age it can be used to describe.
